message.content:
{"id": "13189", "title": "Bug 13189 - Refactoring deleting fields context menu is overridden by message dialog", "description": "When setting up JUnit on LinuxMotif and w2k, the context menu for deleting fields is not shown. Instead, a message dialog immediately asks if the getter/setter should be deleted as well.", "OB": "Before the bug, when right-clicking on 'fName' in the outliner of TestCase.java, a context menu should be shown.", "EB": "After the bug, no context menu is shown and a message dialog pops up asking if the getter/setter should also be deleted.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue:
1. Enable the option 'Code Generator - Remove prefix from field names'
2. Open TestCase.java
3. In the outliner, right-click on 'fName'"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Observe: No context menu is shown, instead, it asks me right awayif I want to delete the getter/setter as well. ', 'SR': "Enable option 'Code GeneratorRemove prefix from field names'3. Open TestCase.java4. In the outliner, right click on 'fName'.5. "}
